# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = split(text, " ")
    max_length = maximum([length(line) for line in lines])
    new_lines = Vector{Vector{Char}}()
    current_line = Vector{Char}()
    for word in lines
        if length(current_line) + length(word) >= text_width
            push!(new_lines, current_line)
            current_line = [word]
        else
            append!(current_line, word)
        end
    end
    push!(new_lines, current_line)
    return join.(new_lines, "\n") |> join
end

# Example
println(wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line"))
```

This function splits the text into words and then builds a new set of lines by appending each word to an existing line if it fits within the `text_width` limit. If a word exceeds the limit, a new line is started. Finally, the lines are joined back together with newline characters before being passed through `join` again to create a single string.
